intro: Forsteronia amblybasis subsp. amblybasis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved forsteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. The plant is native to South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
